resources.string: Exercising regularly has many health benefits, including: • Stronger bones and muscles • Weight maintenance or weight loss • Improved mental health and mood • Increased chance of living longer • Reduced risk of cardiovascular disease, type 2 diabetes, and some cancers • Improved ability to do daily activities and prevent falls

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that adults ages 18 and up get 150 minutes of moderate aerobic activity per week. What is moderate aerobic activity? It is any activity that causes you to raise your heart rate and break a sweat. Examples include walking briskly, taking a dance class, or bicycling at a medium pace.

For beginners: Start slow and be careful not to overdo it. Use the charts feature to track your progress and slowly increase your activity. If you have health complications, talk to your doctor before beginning an exercise program. There are many ways to exercise during your day. Here are a few ideas: • If you drive, park further away and walk briskly to your destination. • Take the stairs instead of the elevator. • Walk to the next furthest bus stop or train station. • Ride a bicycle to work or school.
